basics.name: Celine Honekamp
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: A German-born scientist in sensorimotor control and learning, interested in multisensory perception and action

_volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

courses: M.Sc. Biomechanics, Motor Control/Learning & Motion Analysis

_awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
_awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

_publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
_publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

_publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
_publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

_publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
_publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Visuomotor Delay Adaptation
projects.summary: I am interested in how humans adapt to visuomotor delay in different kind of tasks.

projects.name: Visual Patterns and Motor Control
projects.summary: I am interested in how repetetive high-cintrast patterns confuse the human visual system.

projects.name: Vibro-tactile Feedback as sensory substitution
projects.summary: I am interested in how humans can use vibro-tactile feedback to transfer different information.
